abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Expenditure Reform Adjustment
            Credit (PERAC) aims to a) increase the impact of government
            expenditures on economic and social development and poverty
            reduction; b) improve governance by providing a transparent
            system of budgeting linking budget allocations to program
            objectives and sector strategies; c) strengthen the
            government's administrative capacity to manage public
            expenditures efficiently; and d) establish a fiduciary
            framework enabling the provision of external financial
            assistance. The credit is based on a set of institutional
            reforms and capacity building essential to reach these
            objectives. These include reform of the budget preparation
            system through the use of performance budgeting;
            strengthening of the administrative/institutional capacity
            for more efficient and timely budget execution and
            reporting; establishment of a fiduciary framework; and
            greater use of monitoring and evaluation techniques for
            public expenditures.
